answers.answer: Only thing you can do is take a test when your period is due or contact your doctor and request a blood test. Most "symptoms" of pregnancy are the exact as pms symptoms and some symptoms like nausea and things like that are direct results from increasing hcg levels making you sick which means that you would be showing positive on a pregnancy test. Especially if you believe the date of conception was more then 14 days ago.A lot of us girls on here can tell you that we had every symptom in the book and were SURE we were pregnant and then got our periods. Its just one of those things.

yeah Ive had a few experiences like that but not his bad. Even when I was pregnant. I miscarried though not far into it, only a couple weeks.Thank you so much for your responce, I will keep you updated!

Problem with pregnancy symptoms is that they're so vague and so common that they can be associated with just about anything. As alaysha said, taking a test when your period is due is the only surefire way to know. Good luck!

im not sure if u guys have been ttc, but i dont want to offend u in any way, because what im about to say really does happen with anything. the more u want it, OR think about the symptoms or what U WANT to be feelin, u will because its mental. i mean, u hear all of the time that alot of women have had their normal periods while pregnant, but than again, others spot when others dont,  know what im saying, so as far as these seyptoms, take a test or 2, call ur doctor and make an appointment. it could be stress if ur period is becoming abnormal as well too because ur fiance is gone right now n u miss him, the mind really does play tricks on people and it ***** when ur ttc, let me tell u. let us all know what happens, good luck sweetie, nikkie

Well I went to the doctor yesterday for 2 things. One being Ive been having numb and blue toes and the otehr was to get a req. for a blood preg. test.The doctor was re3ally worried about the toes thing so he just said if your period is late tehn Ill send you fro a blood test. But...he is sending me for a blood test to see if I have a desease causeing my feet to be numb so I dont know why he didnt just test for both. I dont know if the lab people would test for both if I ask while they are at it.So far no AF no cramps no signs of her at all, but they day isnt over.I know those brains of ours so play tricks on us! We'll see.
Well I got the blood test done and they didnt know what the test was for so who knows if they are testing it and seeing wahts not right or what. Day 2 and still no aunt flo, or cramps or anything.
I believe diabetes is what they'd be testing you for, maybe a few others things. But I do know that diabetics do have problems with their feet like that.
Hmm weird. Do you think if I was pegnant they would notice that or do you think they would just be focused on diabetes?

They would want to see if you're pregnant, yes. Because if you're pregnant it might be considered gestational diabetes. I'm not entirely certain and each doctor is different.Now they might be testing for other things as well. They'll test your blood first to see if it might be something else. The blood test measures your insulin. If it comes back abnormal (high or low) they will probably send you for a glucose tolerance test.Sometime in there they will check for pregnancy. They'll probably use the same vial of blood that you already gave.
Good to know. Thanks a bunch.

question: Ok, Im tired of asking about ever symptom...so here is what is going on adn what I have.I haven't been on BC since july of '08. my fiance and I have sex about 3-4 times a week up untill the 10th of january (hes away with the army for 2 months) My last period ended on january 5th (it had been 11 days late but I got it and had it for 5 days. I have been constantly nausious, and queezy and puking every few days for the past month. In this past month, my teeth have been VERY sensative, as well as my gums but not as bad as my teeth. Ive been craving spinach, grapefruits and of course CHOCOLATE. I have been really tired, to the point where I fell asleep at my desk at work. (Im sleeping about 7 hours a night... regular for me if not a bit more) My boobs are sore, nipples are scabby. Headaches, not bad but almost constant. Slightly dizzy at times. Hungrey more than usual. For the past 3 days I have had an increasing pain in the small of my back. I also have been getting a gooey whiteish discharge with no odor for the past month, not as much at night.I think Ive covered everything Ive got now. Let me know what you think.Any imput woudl be greatly appreciated.
title: Ok, Im tired of asking about ever symptom...
